;

;On August 17, 2023, Kolkata, the Indian Navy's new warship INS Vindhyagiri sailed in Hooghly River;(Visual China/Photo);

;

;Recently, the Indian Navy has made a request to purchase the French Scalp long-range cruise missile, hoping to use this missile It serves as the standard anti-ship and ground attack weapon for the 26 Rafale-M carrier-based aircraft equipped with the aircraft carrier INS Vikrant. A month ago, Ukraine used a Scalp cruise missile to destroy a Russian Black Sea Fleet submarine that was being repaired in a Crimean shipyard. This is the only submarine sunk by a cruise missile so far. In addition, the Scalp missile also accurately hit the headquarters building of the Black Sea Fleet, and its performance in actual combat was quite outstanding.

;

;However, this is not the only naval equipment that India has recently purchased from France. On October 28, 2023, the Indian Navy just submitted a purchase request for 26 Rafale carrier-based aircraft to the French government. It can be seen that India is preparing to The carrier-based aircraft will be completely replaced with French Rafales instead of upgrading the Russian-made MiG fighters that have been used for many years.

;

;The procurement plan is by no means simple. It is part of India's ambitious naval reorganization plan.

;

;In 2022, Indian Navy Vice Admiral Ajendra Bahadur Singh told the media: “Some naval ships will be decommissioned in the next few years, and at the same time By adding some more ships, we hope that the number of naval ships will reach more than 200 within 15 years (;to 2037;)."; p>;

;Since India’s independence in 1948, the Indian Navy has always hoped to become a blue water navy with 142 ships and operating two aircraft carriers at the same time. However, so far, the Indian Navy has only about 132 ships and 200 ships. The ship's target seemed a bit difficult.

;

;The difficulty of India's naval expansion is far from a matter of quantity being far from 200 ships. It is that India not only needs to add 68 ships within 15 years, but also needs to acquire most of the navy's main battle equipment within these 15 years. NATOization. This also means that India must eliminate at least one-third of its active main warships, that is, more than 40 ships, in order to achieve the initial goal of NATOization. In this case, India must equip more than 100 ships within 15 years, and India currently equips about 4 new ships every year. At this rate, the Indian Navy may only maintain its current scale, not to mention India's huge equipment expansion The plan also includes building a new aircraft carrier, which is undoubtedly more difficult.

;

;From a realistic perspective, India's naval reorganization plan may not be as ambitious as it claims. The Indian Navy has long relied on Russia to supply equipment, and Russia suffered huge losses in the war. Most of the supporting supply chains for large surface ships in the Soviet era were in Ukraine. Since the Crimean crisis in 2014, Russia has been unable to obtain supporting products from Ukraine. As a result, its large surface ships have difficulty even in overhaul and maintenance, and may no longer be able to continue to supply India in the future.

;

;When India and Russia previously cooperated on the "Chaori King" aircraft carrier renovation project, the progress was delayed and the cost was seriously overrun. At that time, India realized that relying on Russia was unsustainable, so it had begun to build large surface ships on its own. Industry Planning. Unfortunately, India was sanctioned by the United States because of nuclear weapons issues, and could only make do with continuing military cooperation with Russia.

;

;As relations with the United States have heated up rapidly in recent years, India's plan to manufacture its own naval equipment is accelerating.

;

;The first indigenous aircraft carrier "Vikrant" manufactured by India's Cochin Shipyard Limited (CSL) will be officially commissioned in 2022, marking that India has the ability to build its own aircraft carrier - although this The construction of the difficult-to-deliver aircraft carrier has been delayed from the start of construction to the official commissioning. The Indian Navy has been waiting for this for 17 years. However, compared with aircraft carriers, the construction process of India's domestic destroyers can be said to be quite smooth. It only took ten years from the project establishment in 2011 to the commissioning of the first ship in 2021, and it is being launched at a rate of one per year.

;

;At present, India has built three 7,000-ton Visakhapatnam-class destroyers on its own. The ships have a stealth appearance and an Aegis air defense system. India claims that its localization rate has reached 75%. It is a model of Indian warships made in China. It can be seen that the Indian shipbuilding industry has no big problems with technology and construction capabilities, at least in building large battleships of the destroyer level.

;

;Another thing that is good for the Indian shipbuilding industry is the signing of an agreement between India and the United States in 2021, announcing that India will become the future large-scale equipment maintenance center of the U.S. Navy in the Indo-Pacific region. The 2022 US-India 2+2 ministerial dialogue announced that the United States intends to inspect Indian shipyards. Immediately afterwards, the USS Charles Drew (T-AKE-10) docked at Kattupalli Shipyard for maintenance and repairs.

;

;This agreement means that the United States will help India improve its maintenance and construction capabilities of large warships, and even directly provide technical cooperation, allowing India to master the construction and maintenance technology of large U.S. warships, as well as related technical standards and management. process. Judging from the experience of Japan and South Korea, the cooperative weapons and equipment maintenance bases established by the United States after the Korean War played a key role in improving the technology of the local shipbuilding industry and optimizing management processes. In particular, a country like South Korea, which became independent after World War II, has a weak industrial base and a lack of talent. The technical support provided by the United States is crucial to the establishment of its industrial system. Thanks to this, South Korea has also established its own military industry, and even Now it has begun to become a new type of weapons and equipment exporter.

;

;Although India's independent manufacturing capabilities for main battle equipment have long been poor, it has to admit that it has at least independent manufacturing capabilities for naval equipment. The remaining problem is how to connect with American standards and become a Part of the U.S. global military equipment logistics maintenance system. Considering that India's economic development momentum is booming, and the technical restrictions on it by the United States and Europe have been almost completely lifted, it is possible to replace the original Soviet-Russian system and Westernize its naval equipment in 15 years, at least while maintaining the existing Given the scale, it is a completely achievable goal to replace the old and adopt the new. As for whether it can be expanded to a scale of 200 ships, it depends on the execution capabilities of the Indian shipbuilding industry and economic development. However, it is foreseeable that with the help of Western technology, the combat effectiveness of Indian naval ships will definitely be greatly improved. This is also the goal that the United States and India hope to achieve in military cooperation.

;

;;(Lu Junjie/Picture) ;

;

;For related reports, please see ";The dispute between the 94-year-old man and his nanny for 2 million pension funds;"

;

;In the summer, a dazzling news: 94 Lu Delin, a 20-year-old Shanghainese man, told on social media that he was abused by his nanny and defrauded of his pension.

;

;Shanghai is the super-large city with the highest aging population in the country. According to Shanghai's 2022 elderly population and aging undertaking monitoring statistics, the registered elderly population aged 60 and above in Shanghai in 2022 will be 5.5366 million, accounting for nearly 40% of the total registered population. Among them, the number of elderly people living alone is 300,600.

;

;The connection between individual circumstances and the lifeline of the times is about to emerge. It is a topic of public value. After encountering countless stories, I still can’t help but feel the initial excitement and impulse.

;

;Now, standing in winter and thinking back to that summer, the first thing that comes to mind is the part about mosquitoes. The scene we first arrived at was the community where the incident occurred. The community is located in Huangpu District, Shanghai, in the city center. It was built in the early 1990s and has 4 high-rise buildings interspersed with lush tall trees and low grass. It was a summer evening in Shanghai, and there were two or three old people sitting on the benches downstairs enjoying the shade. I wanted to know some surrounding information, and I became the target of "mosquitoes".

;

;The culprit is probably the "flower mosquito" as the local elderly call it. In just three or two hours, it left more than a dozen red and swollen bumps on my legs that were already wearing trousers. It was obviously not appropriate to scratch and chat at the same time, so I had to scratch twice quickly in the gap from one bench to another. The physical feeling was real, and this unspeakable and unseemly detail became the first fragment that hit me in my memory.

;

;This feeling is like a coincidence, and it has been fulfilled in several recent questions, which are about the body. In the topic of Lu Delin, the accused nanny is no longer in the local area. Even during the exchange of evidence before the court session, she still did not appear. The subjects on the other side, the two elderly people, were taken to Hangzhou by their son and daughter-in-law, and their mental condition was not very good for a time. Well, considering that I was afraid that the visit of strangers would bring excitement to the two old people, I did not go to see them.

;

;What is the message left for me? It's an empty house, and there are surrounding clues that need to be found. Room number 2401, pushing open the closed door, the first thing that came out was a sour smell. This is supposed to be well-ventilated, with a square shape, looking into the other side of the living room, with a wide balcony and large windows. There are several orchids on the balcony. The flower pots are quite old, and the branches and leaves are wilting. For a moment, people don't know whether they should be described as being well-groomed or not.

;

;Moldy cutting boards, dirty yellow clothes, expired food, all indicating the disorder of life, suddenly broke into my eyes in an instant. In the eyes of young people, in the undisordered time, what I discussed with my friends around me was more about the spiritual part, and the instinct of the body was automatically ignored in the surface respectability.

;

;The last topic was in Xi'an. The interview subjects were some disabled people. In the continuous rain, we could not wait for the scene of their "reunion" and had to go door to door to chat. During the process, everyone The disorder of the body was mentioned invariably; and after Lu Delin chose the topic, I continued my business trip in Shanghai. The new topic was about Alzheimer's disease. The wife who became a caregiver told the story of taking care of her sick husband for nine years.

;

;From these stories, we can see what everyone is trying their best to maintain, and this effort seems to be an inevitable disorder of life. As a bystander, I hurriedly walked into this forest and felt the "disorder" that I had never experienced in real life. Some disorders are accidental, such as a car accident or sudden illness. They are also unprepared and rush into the forest and never get out; some disorders are slow, such as aging. They are already on the road to aging. It has been too long, so long that I have to admit that aging has come.

;

;Returning to the perspective of journalism, when we encounter these stories, how should we report this disorder? After the initial excitement and impulse, it’s time to write. I think that we should not visit this forest with a pair of curious eyes and notice something unsightly. It should not be regarded as the author's delicate observation and be presented freely. It’s better to enter this forest with a level gaze.

;

;Although this time we entered this forest because of work, such a forest may break into our real life at any time, and in addition to the accident that breaks in at any time, its final arrival is a kind of inevitable.

;

;December At noon on the 1st, Mushahid accepted a face-to-face interview with Southern Weekend reporters. (Photo/Southern Weekend reporter Wang Hang)

;

;On the morning of December 1, Guangzhou Yuexiu International Conference Center. After the one-hour press conference, Pakistani guest Mushahid Hussain Saeed walked out of the venue quickly. Entering December, the weather in Guangzhou turns cooler.

;

;"I like Guangzhou. It has a pleasant climate and is a very dynamic place in China." He said.

;

;Mushahid is the chairman of the Defense Committee of the Senate of Pakistan and the chairman of the Pakistan-China Society. From December 1st to 3rd, he was invited to participate in the 2023 "Understanding China" international conference to discuss and communicate with domestic and foreign guests.

;

;In the past fifty years, Mushahid came to China many times. In his words, he witnessed the poverty-stricken China in the 1970s and the reform and opening-up China in the 1980s. "What we see today is a prosperous and powerful China that is leading the development of globalization." Mushahid said, "I am very happy to witness the rise of China."

;

;On the other hand, Mushahid Shahid spent four years in Washington, the United States, and obtained a master's degree in international relations from Georgetown University's School of Foreign Service, "with an understanding of the U.S. political system and how it operates."

;

;He proposed that there are two different "roads" in the world today. One proposed by the United States and Western countries is security-centered, military-led, and focused on conflicts and confrontations. On the contrary, China insists on connectivity and cooperation, respecting diversity and being more inclusive.

;

;In the past 10 years, the China-Pakistan Economic Corridor, an important pilot project of the “Belt and Road Initiative”, has brought development opportunities to Pakistan. "26 billion U.S. dollars of investment, 250,000 job opportunities, and 28,000 Pakistanis came to China to study. Electricity, roads, hospitals, education, etc. are constantly improving." Mushahid said, "These have benefited Pakistan.";

;Global and regional security are also the focus of the conference. Regarding peace on the India-Pakistan border, Mushahid has optimistic expectations. "Border conflicts can be resolved as long as there is will. We reject global hegemony and we reject regional hegemony."

;

;At noon on December 1, Mushahid accepted a face-to-face interview with Southern Weekend reporters.

;

;“If you want to learn from China, it is crucial to understand China”

;

;;Southern Weekend:; strong>;;Is this your first time to participate in the "Understanding China" forum? How do you feel? ;

;

;;Mushahid: ;;This is my first time to participate in the "Understanding China" forum. This forum is very valuable. First of all, we use this platform to understand China, the region and the world, and how they change and develop. Secondly, it is important for Pakistan to understand China. Because China is our closest strategic partner and our neighbor. Third, personally, I have been dealing with China for nearly fifty years. When I first came to China, I was still a young man of 17 or 18 years old. As a friend of China and a student of Chairman Mao, I saw China at that time. It can be said that I have witnessed China's transformation. If you want to learn from China, it is crucial to understand China. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Compared with the first time you came to China, now what is the difference? ;

;

;;Mushahid:;;The first time I came to China was in the 1970s. At that time, China was very poor and isolated from the world. Today, China has become rich and powerful, a global leader, and a leader in globalization. China has proposed the “One Belt, One Road” initiative to lead green development and technological innovation. So, this is a huge change. In addition to China, the world has also changed. Because the global center of gravity is shifting from the West to the East. This change in China also reflects global changes. ;

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;What are your impressions of Guangdong? For example, for the two big cities of Guangzhou and Shenzhen;

;

;;Mushahid:;;The first time I came to Guangdong Province was in 1972, when Guangzhou A trade fair is being held. During that time, I went shopping at Guangzhou Friendship Store. I only had 200 yuan with me at that time, but I felt like a "millionaire". Because no matter how I bought it, I never spent all the money. At that time, the price of Chinese goods was too cheap. There were no computers at that time, so people used calculators to calculate accounts or calculate money by hand. Then, I took a train from Guangzhou to Hong Kong, which was indeed a wonderful experience. ;

;

;The first time I went to Shenzhen was in 1982, and then in 1984. At that time, Shenzhen was a remote fishing village. After seeing it in person, I also felt that it was too backward and underdeveloped. When I first came to China, the city of Shenzhen did not exist. But in the subsequent 1980s, I saw the rapid rise of Shenzhen.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Many Pakistani businessmen do business in Guangzhou. Can they find business opportunities here? ? ;

;

;Mushahid: Of course. Pakistani businessmen in Guangzhou have been working here for years, even decades. In fact, many trades began not just now, but decades or even centuries ago. Guangzhou has always been a hub of connectivity and a warm and welcoming city. Foreigners are welcome to come here to do business and stay here. It has a pleasant climate, is close to the sea, and is a beautiful city. So Pakistanis enjoy life here, we support them and they can make a lot of money. So I think it's very good and they play a very good role in promoting relations between the people of Pakistan and China.

;

;“Pakistan can learn a lot from China”

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Over the past 40 years, China has undergone tremendous changes. What lessons do you think this has for Pakistan? ;

;

;;Mushahid:;;I think Pakistan can learn a lot from this. First, have a clear vision. Second, there must be the will to turn this vision into reality. Deng Xiaoping, the architect of China's reform and opening up, once said, "Seek truth from facts" and "development is the last word." ;

;

;Insist on development and openness, simplify bureaucracy and cumbersome processes, give talents the attention they deserve, and put them first. Good leadership qualities, policy continuity, learning from mistakes, openness and inclusiveness, focus on people-centered development, etc.

;

;As I said, we can learn a lot from Guangdong, China, and China's reform and opening up.

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Are you confident about Pakistan’s future development? ;

;

;;Mushahid:;;I am very optimistic about the future of Pakistan. I studied in the United States for four years, but I didn’t want to live there. I said I would go back and serve my country. This is thanks to our relationship with China, which is our neighbor and our best friend. China invests extensively in Pakistan. We must unleash the energy and creativity of the people of Pakistan, move forward, reduce bureaucracy and allow them to develop. We need to build industries, innovate, get education, and let them focus on what they should do. ;

;

;;;

;

;;

;

;At a media conference on December 1, Mushahid said that the “One Belt, One Road” initiative is a historic opportunity for Pakistan. (Photo/Southern Weekend reporter Mao Shujie)

;

;Under the "Belt and Road" initiative, development opportunities have come

;

;;Southern Weekend:;;Is the “One Belt, One Road” initiative a development opportunity for Pakistan? ;

;

;;Mushahid:;;The "One Belt, One Road" initiative is a historic opportunity for Pakistan, and we must seize this opportunity. In the past ten years, China has invested US$26 billion in Pakistan, created 250,000 jobs and produced 8,000 megawatts of electricity. These results have given Pakistan and its people confidence in the future. For example, Gwadar Port has developed and become a hub between Pakistan and Central Asian countries. So this is a big opportunity. Because of the “One Belt, One Road” initiative, a whole new world is unfolding. This is a historical opportunity for Pakistan to develop rapidly, and it is also a historical opportunity to learn from China's poverty alleviation and green development model. ;

;
